sentences.en: Chinese art of gilt - and - colored wooden carving enjoys widespread renown.
sentences.cn: 中国镂金错彩的木雕艺术闻名遐迩.

sentences.en: Do you know any places of renown around here?
sentences.cn: 你知道有什么名胜的地方?

sentences.en: Great honor, praise, or distinction accorded by common consent; renown.
sentences.cn: 经一致同意给予极大的荣誉, 表扬或荣耀; 声誉.

sentences.en: He achieved some renown as a football player.
sentences.cn: 作为足球运动员，他小有名气。

sentences.en: He is a man of high renown.
He is an artist of great renown.
sentences.cn: 他是一位极有名望的艺术家.

sentences.en: He won renown as a fair judge.
sentences.cn: 他赢得了公平裁判的荣誉。

sentences.en: He won renown as a pianist.
His renown has spread throughout the country.
How Owen did so can be studied in the volume that brought him his renown.
sentences.cn: 要知欧文何以能够如此,可以研究一下他的成名之作.

sentences.en: I want to see all places of renown in London.
sentences.cn: 我想游览伦敦的所有名胜.

sentences.en: In the intersts of renown the forwardness should lie chiefly in the capacity to handle things.
sentences.cn: 为个人的声名打算,应该在处世接物能力方面比别人先进.

sentences.en: It's just these heart - thrilling chapters that brought his work world renown.
sentences.cn: 正因这些扣人心弦的篇章才使得他的作品举世闻名.

sentences.en: She used to be a singer of some renown.
sentences.cn: 她曾是位小有名气的歌手。

sentences.en: These inventions had obtained for him the renown of more than human sagacity.
sentences.cn: 他的这些发明使人们把他看得神乎其神.

sentences.en: They travelled to Portsmouth, where they embarked on the battle cruiser HMS Renown.
sentences.cn: 他们行至朴次茅斯，在那里登上了英国皇家海军“声望号”战列巡洋舰。

trans.tran_en: when you are famous and a lot of people admire you for a special skill, achievement, or quality
